snippet: Citing a fair 1870 trial, “The Great New Orleans Kidnapping Case” by Michael A. Ross argues that the racial reforms of Reconstruction were not preordained to fail.
abstract: Michael A Ross book The Great New Orleans Kidnapping Case: Race, Law and Justice in the Reconstruction Era argues that racial reforms of Reconstruction were not preordained to fail, interpretation shared by some other scholars.
